captions.text: - Hey, have you met my girlfriend?
- No, it's nice to meet you.
- Oh, uh, no, this is my sister.

- So what you do say,
uh, we get outta here
- Set me up with your sister.

- Please, could you teach
us an Irish drinking song?

- [group] ♫ A lie dee
die dee lie dee die ♫

- 'Cause of the hair, right?
- It's the hair.
It's just, there's a look about you.

- So don't both your
parents have to be gingers--

- It's both grandparents
have to be a ginger.
Does the carpet match the drapes?
- Yeah, I don't really wear sunscreen.

- You know you guys are
going extinct, right?
- I know that you have a soul.
- Oh my god, Jody, you should go as Ariel

- Okay, I'll go as Ariel,
and you can go as Jasmine.

- Well you're not inbred, you
just come from inbreeding.
- You guys sit on flammable stuff?
- It's like Irish Parliament, over here.
- I'm not Irish, are you Irish?

- None of us are Irish.
- Are you Irish?

title: Things Gingers Are Tired Of Hearing

comments.author: Tommy Myers

comments.text:
Alright guys, I see a lot of people in the comments saying that people 
being racist to redheads isn't racism. Well guess what? It is. The English 
were well known to discriminate against the Irish and the Scottish. Hell, 
in America, there were, "No Irish Need Apply" signs on stores, meaning that 
the Irish couldn't work there. The Irish were treated almost as bad as 
blacks. Italians were treated badly too, but I'm getting off-topic. Red 
hair is often associated with being Irish and Scottish, as most of them 
have it. The word ginger is also a racial slur, so please do not use it. 
Use redhead instead, it's just better. Plus, we are a minority, ANY 
minority can be oppressed. Saying redheads can't be is just proof of 
oppression.﻿

comments.author: Mekala Stults

comments.text:
Yep, I can relate to almost every one of these situations. Someone even 
asked me the all-too-common question: "Does the carpet match the drapes?" 
I'd decided to change my answer, so I replied, "No, I have hardwood floors 
and I have blinds for my windows."

People have referred to me as "carrot top", "ginger," (of course), and my 
favorite, "Strawberry Shortcake."
No offense to those of you with golden or ebony locks, but there aren't any 
actual descriptions for particular shades of hair color, right?﻿

comments.author: Vanessa Russell

comments.text:
According to Wikipedia on the blond hair article: "natural blond hair is 
rare in adulthood and only 2% of the world's population is naturally 
blond". However, 26% of the population can at least carry this blond gene. 
Yet on Wikipedia's "human hair colors" article it informs us that redheads 
are also 2% of the population and in places like Scotland it's 13% of the 
population and 40% carry the gene. So, really, we can make a come back any 
time we want.﻿
